title: Coconut
content:
Part of: **[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235925/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235925/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : Rounded Typefaces**

Current URL:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/coconut/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235925/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/coconut/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/coconut/")

Designed by [Patrick Griffin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235925/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Patrick%20Griffin) 2006

Published by [Canada Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016235925/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Canada%20Type)

Coconut is a round and heavy unicase font with the techno, squarish, grid-based squeeze that of late seems part of almost every contemporary pop designs. It works as the 21st century display substitute to tired last-century horses like Frankfurter, VAG, or the rounded Helveticas, Futuras, and DINs out there.

Coconut and Coconut Shadow come in all popular font formats, with a complete character set that is loaded with alternates. Check out the character map for a real techno treat.
author: AndrewSipe
